p: The transmission of these arboviruses is ensured by mosquitoes of the genus Aedes, subgenus Stegomyia [ 1, 16, 17]. Ae. aegypti is the major widespread arbovirus vector in the South Pacific region [ 8]. The invasive species Ae. albopictus is now established in some Pacific islands like Solomon Islands, with an extended range to Fiji and Tonga [ 18]. Other endemic species such as Ae. hensilli or Ae. polynesiensis are also incriminated vectors for the transmission of arboviruses in some PICTs [ 19â€“ 21].
